dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several fifth graders talk among each other before the be of class. The sound is muffled. YOUNG BILLIAM (11) does n and looks lonely at his desk. He draws on some paper bein pleased with his work. Some children accidently push a de against his causing his pencil to move upwards. His pictu ruined with a long straight line in the middle. His littl personal world is disrupted with the bang causing the muf talking around him turn instantly clear. MRS. ZIMMERMAN stands at the front of the class taking attendance.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody settle down now. It may be the first day in class, and I know we’re all excited here. Let’s see if I can learn your names as I take role. The fifth graders quiet down while the standing children down at their desks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Jenny Anderson? JENNY raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Here!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Eric Ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Todd Baxter?

dialogues.speaker: TODD BAXTER
dialogues.text: I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Heather Levington?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER LEVINGTON
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Tim Li?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Here! YOUNG BILLIAM is growing nervous while he begins sinking his chair. Here!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Ashley Nelson?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Laura Rose?

dialogues.speaker: LAURA ROSE
dialogues.text: Here!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN
dialogues.text: Billiam Williams? No one knows who YOUNG BILLIAM is but do notice someone s down in his chair. Some laugh at the name. YOUNG TERRENCE it amusing while lightly jokes to his peers. MRS. ZIMMER looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZIMMERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Billiam Williams? YOUNG BILLIAM continues to sink.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. REP’S OFFICE - PRESENT - AFTERNOON BILLIAM (18) sits across from a well dressed, middle aged admissions representative. The rep has a note pad in his a pen in his hand, looking attentively at BILLIAM.

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS REP
dialogues.text: So your parents named you Billiam?

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS REP
dialogues.text: Could be worse. I once knew a kid who’s parents named him Bobert.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS REP
dialogues.text: Yeah. (laughs) We mocked the hell outta that kid! (continues to laugh) BILLIAM is unamused, and the admissions rep notices this.

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS REP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (clears his throat) Sorry. Please, continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to know so much about my childhood?

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS REP
dialogues.text: Well, when we ask most people to talk about their childhood on this form they at least give us something. You just wrote “Not Applicable”. BILLIAM nods slightly.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: (Agreeing) Mmmhmm.

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS REP
dialogues.text: Would you really describe your childhood as “Not applicable”? BILLIAM opens his mouth as if he’s about to say something thinking very hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtitle: “2000” YOUNG BILLIAM sits at a lunchroom table, all alone.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM, (V.0O)
dialogues.text: Back then, kids were (pause) —- less than civil towards me. YOUNG BILLIAM suddenly gets hits directly in the face wit large, sloppy sandwich. Shocked, he wipes the contents of sandwich from his face as loud laughter erupts from off s Seated across the lunchroom is YOUNG TERRENCE, the source laughter. YOUNG TERRENCE sits amongst his lackeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrence was my constant tormentor. YOUNG TERRENCE retrieves another sandwich from his paper sack.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM, (V.O)
dialogues.text: And over the years it became quite apparent to me that Terrence’s mother stocked him with a steady supply of sandwiches. YOUNG TERRENCE begins to happily eat his next sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM sits in class and gets hit with a sandwich back of the head. YOUNG TERRENCE’S laughter erupts behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM stands at the urinal and gets hit with anot sandwich. YOUNG TERRENCE LAUGHS off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM prepares to catch a kicked ball in the back gym and gets hit with a ball from behind by the laughing YOUNG TERRENCE.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM, (V.0O)
dialogues.text: Well, c'mon, he couldn't always throw sandwiches. That's just ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But my mother was always there for me when I got home. And she always tried to make me feel better about the situation.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Oh, Billiam. YOUNG BILLIAM’S mother picks a piece of tomato out of his

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know why the kids do this to you?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: (sniffling) Because my name's Billiam?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, heavens no. It's because they're jealous of you. YOUNG BILLIAM lifts his head, displaying a look of hope.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Really? His mother nods, smiling. YOUNG BILLIAM smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. REP’S OFFICE - PRESENT

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: What were they jealous of? The friends I didn’t have? The social skills I was unable to acquire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your mom sounds like a pretty smart person. I mean, my mom told me the same thing, and lI... (look of realization) Oh..

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: The worst part was that I actually listened to her. (thinks) Wait a minute, no. That’s not the worst part. The worst part was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM walks to his seat, and YOUNG TERRENCE stick foot out to trip him. YOUNG BILLIAM falls with a thud. YOUNG TIM, who sits all alone in the corner, watches this YOUNG BILLIAM comes back to his feet and turns to YOUNG TERRENCE.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: You know what, Terrence? I know why you pick on me.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: You’re just jealous of me, and you pick on me because you’re really insecure YOUNG BILLIAM (CONT’D) about yourself, and need to make me feel bad to make yourself feel better. YOUNG TIM, hearing this, shuts his eyes wincing. YOUNG TE pauses as he takes this all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) You know what? You're right. I am jealous of you. All I really want to be is your friend.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Really? YOUNG TERRENCE reaches into his pocket and pulls out a sa throwing it in YOUNG BILLIAM’S face. He walks away, and Y BILLIAM stands there, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM, (V.0O)
dialogues.text: My first run-in with sarcasm. YOUNG TIM shakes his head, getting up from his seat and w over to YOUNG BILLIAM. He pulls out some tissues from his and hands them to YOUNG BILLIAM.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM, (V.O)
dialogues.text: And that’s when I first met my best friend, Tim.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: He’s not really jealous of you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: But my mom said he was.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Well, there’s your first problem. When it comes to bullies, never listen to your mother. YOUNG BILLIAM thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was right. And the more I thought about it, the more I remembered all the horrible advice my mother had given me. INT. BILLIAM’S LIVING ROOM - FLASHBACK YOUNG BILLIAM is looking up to his mother. She is cutting in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Just ignore them, and they'll stop picking on you.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM is counseled by his mother at the dining ro table.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: The next time they pick on you, you just tell your teacher. She'll make everything better.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM is leaning against the wall in his bathrobe mother talks in the background.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: I think it's time I gave their parents a call. Once they get a good talking to, they'll stop picking on you.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MOM is tucking in YOUNG BILLIAM in his bed. It is night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won’t bother you anymore, much like that boogeyman you mentioned before hiding under your bed. Goodnight dear. MOM gets up and walks towards the door. As she does, YOUN BILLIAM’s eyes are wide open with a sense of realization old fear. While finding enough courage, he grabs his flas turns it on, and slowly looks under the bed. The flashlight shines towards a body under the bed appear be YOUNG TERRENCE. He holds a sandwich in his right hand moves it towards him. YOUNG BILLIAM wakes up in a sweat screaming.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Mom! The boogeyman is Terrence! INT. REP’S OFFICE - PRESENT

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Her heart was in the right place, but she just didn't understand what it was really like. Sure bullies were probably insecure with themselves which caused them to pick on those lesser than them, but knowing that didn't help as a little kid. In the end, there are just no good ways to deal with a bully. BILLIAM smiles deviously.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But there are some bad ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM and YOUNG TIM sit at a lunchroom table, eat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and I basically became inseparable for the next several months. I’d like to say by that time I’d taken care of my Terrence situation, but I can say that things were at least starting to change. YOUNG BILLIAM gets hit with a sandwich, which smears acro his face and falls on the table. He remains unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Hmm. Terrence’s mother switched to Miracle Whip. He wipes off his face with a nearby napkin, and continues eating.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: At least she stopped using toothpicks. (pause) You ever going to stand up to him?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, my mom says I should try not to give him a big reaction.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Your mom?! You’re still listening to your mom?! Are you kidding? Nothing she’s said has worked, Bill! Seriously, you need to do something. If you don't, he’1l never stop. EVER!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: I know. YOUNG BILLIAM sits there and thinks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone needs to hit him with a sandwich. YOUNG BILLIAM suddenly gets a look of realization across face.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: I’ve got it.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: We're going to settle this on the playground. YOUNG TIM looks confused. EXT. BILLIAM’S HOUSE - FLASHBACK - AFTERNOON YOUNG BILLIAM and YOUNG TIM walk out from the back door i hurry wearing backpacks filled with sandwiches. Attached their pants are walky-talkies. They begin to head towards garage until a car door shuts. YOUNG BILLIAM moves his arm to stop YOUNG TIM from procee further. They hide around the corner from being seen. BIL peeks and sees his mother walking towards the front door bag of groceries.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Civilian hostile spotted.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Should we initiate plan B? YOUNG BILLIAM turns towards YOUNG TIM.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Affirmative. Get ready. The boys detach their walky-talkies from their pants and them on.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Tim, your objective is to watch her every move. You can reach me on here.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Will do.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Okay. Go! The boys set ways. YOUNG BILLIAM’S mother walks into the house. YOUNG BILLIA his way towards the garage while YOUNG TIM starts sneakin the house windows. YOUNG BILLIAM brings the walky-talkie his mouth. His head peeks around the corner for a clear v

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Tango Lee Seven this is Bravo Whiskey Six. Radio check, over!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Bravo Whiskey Six, this is Tango Lima Seven. I read you loud and clear, over!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Roger, Tango Lee Seven. Give me a sitrep, over! YOUNG TIM looks into the window: she is dancing with a ca

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Target is in sight. YOUNG TIM rolls his eyes and gets back into a hiding posi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be advised, crazy mom close, over. YOUNG BILLIAM makes it to the garage and quietly sneaks t the garage door. He speaks into the walky-talkie again.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Tango Lima Seven, I’m in position, over. YOUNG TIM peeks through the window again but does not see

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: All clear, Bravo Whiskey Six. Mission is a go. I repeat, mission is a go!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Roger, Wilco! Go mission! Over and out! YOUNG BILLIAM grabs the garage door handle and opens it. in as YOUNG TIM follows him from behind. They run out wit ladder, tape, and a long rope. YOUNG BILLIAM’s mother barely recognizes them just in tim they slowly run off with a large ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM is on a ladder as TIM hands him the next ba of sandwiches. A rope is attached to a closed net attache the hoop. Duck tape is below the hoop in a formation of a

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: You sure this is a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: No, I think it’s a bad one! You want out?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: No. I was just thinking of one sandwich. I think we made a hundred sandwiches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge is messy. You said it yourself, Tim. I have to stand up to Terrence. If I don’t, he’1ll never stop. I tried telling the teacher. I tried ignoring him. I tried to look brave. I tried to pretend I don’t care. But I do care. It’s time for Terrence to get a taste of his own medicine.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: What if it doesn’t work?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: It will work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BILLIAM and YOUNG TIM stand at the playground to th school, waiting. YOUNG TIM glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Maybe he won’t show.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: He’1l show. Suddenly in the distance, YOUNG TERRENCE shows up on his The scene plays in slow motion. He ride up to the playgro tosses his bike to the ground, his long coat tails flutte the wind (in slow motion a la John Woo). YOUNG BILLIAM an TIM watch this. YOUNG TERRENCE approaches the duo.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Well, well, well.. if it isn’t Billiam Williams. YOUNG BILLIAM and YOUNG TIM exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you brought your friend Dim Tim.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Hi Terry.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE
dialogues.text: I got your note. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: I just want to teach you a lesson.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? And what’s that?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: That when someone you’ve tortured for his entire life asks you to meet him out in a secluded area- (pause) you should always watch where you stand. YOUNG TERRENCE looks down to find that he is standing on X. YOUNG BILLIAM pulls a string. YOUNG TERRENCE sees YOUN BILLIAM pull the string and looks up as a giant bucket of sandwiches is released above his head. A hundred sandwiches fall out of the bucket and fall all YOUNG TERRENCE. YOUNG TERRENCE slowly looks up from his f YOUNG BILLIAM and YOUNG TIM.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE
dialogues.text: You're dead. As they move forward, YOUNG BILLIAM and YOUNG TIM start b up.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Uh, Bill? What was your plan for after we hit him with the sandwiches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s about as far as I got. YOUNG TERRENCE backs them both into a tree, grabbing YOUN BILLIAM and raising his fist.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE
dialogues.text: (smiling) I’m really going to enjoy this. YOUNG BILLIAM winces, waiting for impact when in the dist car engine is heard revving. YOUNG TERRRENCE slowly turns head around. Far in the distance, a silver station wagon sits at the e the parking lot. The engine revs again. YOUNG TERRENCE lets go of his grip and walks towards the

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, what’s this?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Bill? Is that your mother? YOUNG BILLIAM simply stares ahead, nodding in shock. YOUNG TERRENCE squints towards the car to get a better look. He laughs to himself.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Aww, isn't that cute? Billy called his mommy to come and save him. The car engine revs again.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Nobody hurts my boy and gets away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car suddenly peels forward, towards YOUNG TERRENCE. Y TERRENCE’s face drops in horror, as he begins to run in t opposite direction. He runs towards his bike and hops on, pedaling away. YOUNG TERRENCE cowardly screams as he drives his bike fas YOUNG BILLIAM’s mother on his tail. They drive off into t distance and disappear, leaving YOUNG BILLIAM and YOUNG T alone.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TIM
dialogues.text: Wow. (pause) Your mom is insane. YOUNG BILLIAM smiles, as he stares off to where they drov off.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Naw, she just loves me. YOUNG BILLIAM pats YOUNG TIM on the back. They walk off.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. REP’S OFFICE - PRESENT

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: And, so that’s how it ended. Terrence ended up transferring to a new school, and I really haven’t seen him since. The ADMISSION REP places his folder on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I must say, that’s one heck of a story. And I can see why you didn’t try and fit that into a single essay. The ADMISSION REP sticks out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS REP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’1l let you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIAM walks out into the lobby and looks around to see students sitting in a line of chairs. At the front of the TERRENCE. He looks up and notices BILLIAM, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Terrence?

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Oh hey, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: You’re going to this school?

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: If they let me. Awkward pause as the two think of what to say.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, good luck Terrence.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Hey, you too. BILLIAM begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Billiam! BILLIAM shields his face in terror, wincing. He looks bac see TERRENCE is sticking out his hand, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good to see you. BILLIAM shakes TERRENCE’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe we can get together and get a bite to eat sometime. No sandwiches of course. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’d like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIAM and TERRENCE are talking to each other as they ea window. Laughs are exchanged as they recall stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIAM walks with TERENCE down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: It was great seeing you again. My car is right up there. Where is yours?

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s at the shop. There were some problems with the engine and had to get  it fixed.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: That sucks, man. Need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: Uh, my mom is picking me up. TERRENCE is in shock.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE
dialogues.text: She's... what? BILLIAM looks at him questionably.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: She’s picking me up. I told her to arrive about this time. BILLIAM glances around.

dialogues.speaker: BILLIAM
dialogues.text: She should be here... oh, there she is. TERRENCE looks where BILLIAM is looking at. He spots his standing outside the car. Her eyes lock on TERRENCE with grin.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: You! TERRENCE panics and begins running the opposite direction around the corner. BILLIAM is confused and watches him ru BILLIAM’S MOTHER gets in the car quickly and turns it on, storming after TERRENCE.
